column2: PHILIPPINE ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS (140 points)

What is the law that established the Philippine Environmental Impact Statement System (PEISS)?                   a. PD 1586                              c. RA 9275                                                                                               b. RA 6969                                d. RA 9003

c. DAO 2003-30                        d. DAO 2017-15

What is !he alteration of !he physical, chemical and biological properties of the atmosphere that will or is likely to create or to render the air resources of the country harmful, detrimental, or injurious to public health, safety or welfare?                                                                                                                                                a. Harmful air                            c. Air inhalation Â·                                                                                       b. Air pollution                           d. Hazardous air

Atmosphere                          c. Air shed                                                                                                 b. Common area                       d. Air component

Air pollution                            c. Pollution limits                                                                                       b. Ambient air                            d. Ambient air quality guideline values

Breathable air                                   c. Pollution concentration                                                                b. Ambient air quality standard               d. Concentrated air

Important pollutants                                                                    b. Critical pollutants                                d. Harmful pollutants

Discharge                                         c. Air flow                                                                                      b. Emission                                           d. Compressed air

Standard cubic meter                        c. Dry cubic meter                                                                        b. Normal cubic meter                            d. Wet cubic meter

Permit to Operate                                c. Operation permit                                                                       b. Permit to Construct                              d. Equipment permit

Air filter                                    c. Air compressor                                                                                   b. Pollution control device              d. Air bag

Stationary source                    c. Chimney                                                                                              b. Smoke stack                           d. Vent

Hydrogen sulfide                                                                                   b. Carbon monoxide                    d. Lead

Emission credits                    c. Carbon credits                                                                                       b. Emissions trading                  d. None of the above

Combustion                           c. Incineration                                                                                           b. Gasification                           d. None of the above

What refers to pollution control devices, production processes, fuel combustion processes or other means that effectively prevent or reduce emissions or effluents?                                                                                    a. Pollution control technology                    c. Advance technology                                                               b. Pollution technology                               d. None of the above

Whal is an area where the existing ambient air quality is at or below National Ambient Air Quality Guideline Values?                                                                                                                                                    a. Attainment                             c. Pristine                                                                                                 b. Good air quality                     d. Clean air

None of the above

Controlled area                    c. Poor air quality                                                                                        b. Non-attainment                    d. None of the above

Annual National Air Quantity Status Report                c. Pollution Report                                                    b. Air Pollution Report                                                 d. None of the aboved

Air Pollution Fund                                                    c. Guarantee Fund                                                    b. Air Quality Management Found                                 d. None of the above

Haze                                                                                                        b. Albedo                               d. None of the above

Carbon dioxide                                                                                          b. Halons                               d. Ozone Depleting Substances

Fog machine                                                                                            b. Ringelmann Chart               d. None of the above

a. Open burning c. Yard fire 
b. Siga d. None of the above

What is used to determine smoke opacity in exhaust gases emitted by an engine?
a. Opacimeter c. Smoke machine 
b. Dosimeter d. None of the above

What is the law that established the Clean Water Act (CWA)? 
a. RA 9275       c. RA 8749 
b. RA 9003       d. RA 6969

What issuance provided the Implementing Rules and Regulations of the CWA? 
a. DAO 21                    c. DAO 2005-10 
b. DAO 2000-81           d. DAO 2017-15

What refers to the alteration of the physical, chemical or biological or radiological properties of a water body resulting in the impairment of its purity or quality?
a. Pollution             c. Water contamination 
b. Water pollution   d. None of the above

What is a layer of water-bearing rock located underground that transmits water in sufficient quantity to supply pumping wells or natural springs? 
a. Deep well            c. Groundwater
b. Aquifer               d. None of the above

What is the introduction of substances not found in the natural composition of water that make the water less desirable or unfit for intended use? 
a. Pollution              c. Contamination 
b. Dischargmg        d. None of the above

What is the act of spilling, leaking, pumping, pouring, emitting, emptying, releasing or dumping of any material into a water body?
a. Discharge          c. Intentional flow
b. Flow                  d. None of the above

What are discharges from known source passed into a body of water or land, or wastewater flowing out of a
manufacturing plant, industrial plant including domestic, commercial and recreational facilities? 
a. Wastewater            c. Effluent 
b. Hazardous flow       d. None of the above

What is the legal restriction or limitation on quantities, rates or concentrations of physical, chemical orbiological parameters of effluents?
a. Pollution limit         c. Effluent guideline
b. Effluent standard   d. None of the above

What is a surface water body containing less than 500 ppm dissolved common salt, sodium chloride called?
a. Freshwater          c. Lake
b. River                  d. None of the above

What is subsurface water that occurs beneath a water table in soil sand rocks, or geological formations?

a. Aquifer          c. Groundwater
b. Deepwell       d. None of the above

a. Integrated Water Quality Management Framework
b. Integrated Water Quality Framework
c. Integrated Water Pollution Framework
d. None of the above

a. Water Quality Report                            c. Water Pollution Report

a. Runoff                     c. Erosion

a. Hazardous sediment       c Septage

a. Night Soil        c. Hazardous wates
